intro: Eschweilera piresii subsp. piresii, commonly known as the Pires' sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lecythidaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of eastern Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, red-brown flowers that attract various pollinators. Its fruits are woody capsules that release seeds when mature, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
